abstract: After two years of soaring share prices, the Shanghai composite index has plunged 45 percent from its high, reached last October.
snippet: After two years of soaring share prices, the Shanghai composite index has plunged 45 percent from its high, reached last October.
lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI  A year ago, investors like Guan Ling were ebullient. Chinese share prices had climbed over 500 percent in the span of two years, setting off a nationwide stock buying frenzy.

headline.main: To See a Stock Market Bubble Bursting, Look at Shanghai
headline.print_headline: The Bursting Of a Bubble In Shanghai

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
